humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest focus of the invasive neoplasm measures 34 mm (3.4 cm) in greatest dimension. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the 'invasive neoplasm measures 34 mm in greatest dimension and is present 2 mm from the posterior margin and 5 mm or greater from all other margins.' This meets the criteria for a T2 stage (T2: Tumor size > 2 cm and ≤ 5 cm).
